id: Starbucks fourth-quarter profit, revenue beat estimatesInvestingTop Stories
paragraph: November 1, 20184:23 PM EDTLast UpdatedNovember 1, 20184:51 PM EDTSEATTLE — Starbucks Corp. on Thursday reported fiscal fourth-quarter net income of US$755.8 million.The Seattle-based company said it had profit of US56 cents per share. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs, were US62 cents per share.The results beat Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of 13 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of US59 cents per share.The coffee chain posted revenue of US$6.3 billion in the period, which also beat Street forecasts. Ten analysts surveyed by Zacks expected US$6.2 billion.Starbucks expects full-year earnings in the range of US$2.61 to US$2.66 per share.Starbucks shares have risen two per cent since the beginning of the year, while the Standard & Poor’s 500 index has increased two per cent. At the close of trading on Thursday, shares hit $58.63, an increase of slightly more than six per cent in the past 12 months.This content was provided by Market One for commercial purposes.
